original: Öster, Karl-Inge, förste läkare, Vadstena, f. 6/7/05 i Ore, Kopparb. 1., av ikommin. Erik Helmer Bernhard Ö. o. Ingeborg Märta Katarina Nordlund. G. 34 m. Margareta Linnéa Bengtsson. Barn: Ingemar f. 36. — Stud:-ex. i Västerås 24, med. kand. 27 o. med. lic. 32 v. Karol. inst. Assist :l’äk. v. Karlstads las. med. avd. sex mån. 32-33’, v. dess kir. avd. samt tf. tredje und :läk. där 33’, e. läk. v. Mariebergs sjukh. 33-34, e. o. andre läk. v. Sal-berga sjukh. 34-36, andre läk. v. Birgittas sjukh. i Vadstena 37, förordn. s. förste läk. där sam|manlagt 2 år o. 5 mån., förste läk. där sed. 43, förordn. s. överläk. 1 år o. 2 mån., s. sjukhuschef 5^ mån., tf. sinnessjukläk. v. rättspsyk. klin. å Långholmen 42-43, tf. bitr. föredrag, i rättspsyk. ärenden i med:styr. 9^ mån., rådg. psykiater v. fångv:anst. i Norrköp. 46.
translated: Öster, Karl-Inge, first doctor, Vadstena, b. 6/7/05 in Ore, Kopparberg County, son of newcomer Erik Helmer Bernhard Ö. and Ingeborg Märta Katarina Nordlund. Married in 1934 to Margareta Linnéa Bengtsson. Children: Ingemar, b. 1936. Graduated from Västerås College in 1924, received a degree in medicine in 1927, and a medical license in 1932 from the Karolinska Institute. Assistant doctor at Karlstad Hospital Medical Department for six months in 1932-1933, at its surgical department and acting as a temporary third assistant doctor in 1933. Medical doctor at Marieberg Hospital in 1933-1934, deputy and second doctor at Salberga Hospital in 1934-1936, second doctor at Birgitta's Hospital in Vadstena in 1937. Appointed as first doctor there for a total of 2 years and 5 months. Became first doctor in 1943, appointed as assistant chief doctor for 1 year and 2 months, then became the hospital's chief for 5 and a half months. Acted as temporary psychiatrist at the forensic psychiatric clinic on Långholmen in 1942-1943, as acting assistant lecturer in forensic psychiatric matters in the medical board for 9 and a half months. Consultative psychiatrist at the prison in Norrköping in 1946.
